intro: Amaranthus scleranthoides f. chathamensis, commonly known as the Chatham Islands amaranth, is a flowering plant native to the Chatham Islands of New Zealand. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, greenish flowers that are followed by triangular, spiny seed capsules. It thrives in coastal environments and is adapted to the dry, sandy soils of its native habitat. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution.
